sub_title: Air Quality SME | GHG Emissions Management | Technology Assessment | Business Planning | Program Implementation | Business Partnering
summary:
I am a qualified subject matter expert for air quality, flaring and venting with 21 years’ experience in a consulting and advisory capacity across a range of resource and manufacturing industries, including refining, oil and gas.
	
I specialise in greenhouse gas emissions management, with the most recent focus being methane. I am eminently versatile and self-motivated, with focused attention to technical detail.  I am an ethical, cooperative team player and am comfortable engaging with a wide variety of stakeholders.

education.field_of_study: RACQSA-QM Quality Management Systems, Management Systems Auditing, Leading Audit Teams

certifications.name: Field Identification of Weeds of Queensland
GIQ Coal Surfaces Training
certifications.authority: Baseline Training (Part of Corporate Protection Australia Group)

certifications.name: Mining and Resource Contractors Safety Training Association (MARCSTA)

profile_positions.title: Senior Carbon / Air Business Delivery Advisor

profile_positions.description:
As part of the corporate Carbon & Environment Delivery team I work closely with other technical experts and the Directorate business leads developing programs to meet asset management needs. I am currently focused on the implementation of OGMP 2.0 Gold Standard reporting across Shell's in-scope operated and non-operated ventures, leading the site-level monitoring and reconciliation component of the program:

🔹 Leading the implementation of OGMP site-level monitoring across 15 operated assets, on-track to deliver on 2022 commitments, establishing a credible pathway to 2023 Gold Standard reporting.
🔹 Providing technical SME support for OGMP source-level monitoring program, and leading the development of guidance and tools to expedite successful implementation across Shell’s in-scope operated assets.
🔹 Leading the Shell Leak Detection & Repair Recommended Practice refresh and driving step improvements in methane fugitive leak quantification and reporting methods.
profile_positions.title: Air & GHG Delivery Advisor

profile_positions.description:
In my role with Shell Australia, I was the Air Quality and GHG Focal Point for 6 Shell operated and non-operated ventures, partnering across departments and functions to drive improvements in regulatory reporting, emissions management and mitigation:

🔹 Lead the methane emission source review deep-dive, facilitating improvements over 2 years that led to a 52% reduction in methane for QGC Upstream.
🔹 Local Product Owner driving the successful implementation of “Tier 3 Dynamic” LDAR program for an Australian LNG asset realising 87% reduction in reported fugitive emissions.
🔹 Built a trusted relationship with community air quality group resulting in an evidenced improvement in knowledge and perception; averting significant business costs and establishing a blueprint for effective collaboration which is now being replicated by government.
🔹 Technical authority for Qld-situated Power Station environmental permit criteria amendments commercialising increased operational availability ($360k/p.a) and maintenance cost avoidance (>$2.1M/p.a).
🔹 Managed well work-over methane emissions investigation, resulting in process change, abating 300ktpa CO2-e and reducing costs (>$1M/p.a) associated with a critical activity.
profile_positions.title: Senior Air Quality and Greenhouse Gas Specialist

profile_positions.description:
This COO role in the Operations team provided me with greater insight into commercial and other drivers for business success. I facilitated the transmission of natural gas from production points to industrial and domestic users and export points, managing pipeline network transactions across Western Australia and Queensland, into NSW and Victoria:

🔹 Managed Shipper/Trader customer relationships and executed Gas Transportation Agreement (GTA) contracts.
🔹 Addressed National Gas Law and Short-Term Trading Market (STTM) regulatory obligations.
🔹 Initiated an investigation of lost pipeline line-pack, resulting in claim-back of 50TJ/$260K of unaccounted gas.
🔹 Supported control operators in optimising safe, reliable pipeline operation and maximising revenue opportunities.
profile_positions.title: Commercial Operations Officer

profile_positions.description:
In this short-term contract with SLR Consulting, I was commissioned to "deep dive", assure and improve current regulatory and internal GHG reporting practices:

🔹 Managed greenhouse gas and air quality regulatory and internal reporting obligations for multiple natural gas assets.
🔹 Conducted internal assurance and developed and implemented a GHG reporting improvement plan to address findings.
🔹 Audited air emissions monitoring reports against relevant standards and engaged with vendors to improve the quality of their service offerings.
profile_positions.title: Associate Consultant

profile_positions.description:
As Technical Advisor for Arrow Energy I was primarily responsible for GHG and air quality regulatory and JV partner reporting obligations, however my role broadened on my previous position into Biodiversity Offsets legislation and I worked with consultant experts to address business obligations associated with the assets' disturbance footprint:

🔹 Managed regulatory and JV partner reporting obligations for GHG and air quality.
🔹 Lead assurance activities on GHG inventories, improving reporting accuracy and minimising taxation >$AUD10M.
🔹 Developed quality system and project documentation (Construction Environmental Management Plans and Key Aspect Management Plans) for Operations and Projects.
🔹 Engaged with regulatory authority to remove low risk sources from environmental permits, saving $AUD50K/p.a.
profile_positions.title: Technical Environment Advisor

profile_positions.description:
As the Corporate Environment Advisor - Carbon my responsibilities included addressing the requirements of multiple legislative instruments; NGER Act, Clean Energy Act and Energy Efficiency Opportunity Act as well as managing air quality permit obligations:

🔹 External assurance facilitator for various third-party consultants auditing facilities per the Clean Energy Act legislation, during which 'no significant audit findings' were identified.
🔹 Provided technical support to Operations and drove efficiency improvements in the emissions monitoring program across the fleet of field assets, reducing the required testing frequency and associated costs and resource support.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Environment Advisor - Carbon

profile_positions.description:
I held the position of Quality Manager for the three affiliated companies (ECS Assist, ECS Stack and ECS Instruments) whilst also acting as Senior Environmental Consultant for ECS Assist Pty Ltd. I primarily managed the certification of the ECS group of companies to ISO 17025:2005 (laboratory NATA accreditation) and ISO 9001:2008 (quality management system) and also managed the client relationships for a number of large industrial companies, primarily Alcoa World Alumina; Pinjarra, Wagerup and Kwinana.

I specialised in consulting to the power generation industry and projects included testing for licence compliance purposes, commissioning & tuning projects, load testing and efficiency determination. I completed projects of this nature for clients such as BP (Bulwer Island & Kwinana), Woodside (LNG Phase IV) and Stanwell Power Station.

🔹 Managed certification of the technical (ISO 17025) and quality (ISO 9001) management systems.
🔹 Managed emissions monitoring contracts worth >$AUD1.5M across Australia.
🔹 Lead auditor for Continuous Emission Monitoring Systems (CEMS online instrumentation) audits.
🔹 Performed emissions impact assessments and literature reviews.
profile_positions.title: Senior Environmental Consultant & Quality Manager

profile_positions.description:
My role as Senior Environmental Scientist required me to autonomously operate a Brisbane-based satellite office and Gladstone field office, managing the client contracts, procuring ongoing work and resourcing equipment and people to perform highly complex and logistically difficult testing programs throughout Australia.

🔹 Project-managed emissions monitoring requirements for 19 industrial clients across three Australian States.
🔹 Technical authority position as NATA signatory for issuance of emissions monitoring reports (ISO17025).
🔹 Team lead supervising and training technical support staff to proficiency level in emissions test methods.
profile_positions.title: Senior Environmental Scientist

profile_positions.description:
As an Environmental Scientist, I managed emissions monitoring programs for a number of Western Australian-based clients, developing proficiency in point, diffuse (fugitive) and ambient air quality monitoring for a wide range of parameters across most industry types, including; metals refining, petrochemical, power generation, glass smelting, crematoria, cement manufacturing and brickworks.

I have demonstrated proficiency in the following methods;
🔹 USEPA Methods (United States Environmental Protection Agency): 1, 1A, 2, 2A, 3, 3A, 4, 5, 6, 6C, 7, 7E, 8, 10, 11, 12, 13B, 17, 18, 20, 23, 26, 26A, 29, 0010, 0011, 0030, 0061, 201A, SW-846-0011, TO-5, 
TO-11A, TO-17, VOST 0030, 0031, 0040.
🔹 Californian Air Resources Board: CARB M501a
🔹 Australian Standards: 4323.1, 4323.2, 4323.3, 3543-1989, 2724.3, 2922, 3580.3.1, 4.1, 7.1, 8.1, 9.6, 11.1, 13.3, 2922, 2724.3.
profile_positions.title: Environmental Scientist

volunteer_experiences.description: Members of the Climate Reality Leadership Corps lead educational events and encourage activity to address climate change in their local communities.

Conservation Volunteers Australia (CVA) is a national organisation working with communities to re-balance nature for a stronger, more resilient future. Volunteering activities include weeding tracts of native forest, re-vegetating koala habitat corridors and participating in ocean and beach litter collection events.

The Rainbow Bridge Fund is a non profit organisation receiving no government assistance and run by a small, dedicated group of vets, nurses and volunteers working to care for and socialise cats that are unwanted and have been dumped or need re-homing.

Volunteered as an environmental educator under the work experience scheme for the Monkey Mia Dolphin Information Centre, assisting staff in their regular duties of caring for Bottlenose Dolphins and making recordings of dolphin behaviour.

skills: 🔹 Subject matter expert in air quality, venting and flaring with technical expertise in carbon and methane.
